Articles.Content:
I\'ve tried searching for this topic but I\'m not coming up with any results.

I\'ve seen some Youtube videos of camera angles I\'ve not seen ingame such as a camera looking from the surface of Kerbin zoomed into a rocket high up etc.

Are these mods?
Thanks for the quick reply. I guess I unzip this into the Plugins folder?

Just drag the files within the 'Plugins' folder into the KSP plugin directory and the files within the 'Parts' folder into the KSP directory of parts. Sorry if that was a little confusing, it\'s hard for me to explain. You may want to wait for a better guide.

I understood so thanks. Where do I put the files from 'alternate stock cockpit CFGs'?

Thanks again.

I understood so thanks. Where do I put the files from 'alternate stock cockpit CFGs'?

Thanks again.

Those are just optional. I didn\'t use them. But if you want to install them, go into the camera part folder and just drag it in. It will overwrite the original though.

Those alternate configs would go in the parts folder so they overwrite the vanilla game files. They replace the vanilla configs with information allowing them to give you a cockpit view.

Cheers!

Capt\'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager

Those alternate configs would go in the parts folder so they overwrite the vanilla game files. They replace the vanilla configs with information allowing them to give you a cockpit view.

Cheers!

Capt\'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager

Oh ok then. Thanks Skunky.
OK maybe I\'m being a complete mong but I\'ve put everything where it\'s meant to be but F7 and F8 do nothing...Nor is right-clicking. Why don\'t they put a readme in these zips?
Are you putting the cameras on your ships? They are in the slot with the parachute if you don\'t know.

Ahhhhh....It\'s nice to get some good instructions.

Cheers...I\'ll check it out.

So are all the cams on the craft? I saw a cam on Kerbin pointing up at a launching craft like the footage you see from NASA launches. I assume this doesn\'t have that?

Ahhhhh....It\'s nice to get some good instructions.

Cheers...I\'ll check it out.

So are all the cams on the craft? I saw a cam on Kerbin pointing up at a launching craft like the footage you see from NASA launches. I assume this doesn\'t have that?

With the cameras you can get virtually any angle you like. Just use WASD or Q and E to rotate them.
But what I mean is can I put them on the ground?
Not sure, you may want to check the original thread. I\'m not entirely sure about the limits of this plug-in.

Nope, atm they are currently only usable by attaching to a craft.

Cheers!

Capt\'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager

But what I mean is can I put them on the ground?

Get cart mod with it place camera\'s on cart then agle it then boom camera on ground sorta

Get cart mod with it place camera\'s on cart then agle it then boom camera on ground sorta

It helps if you also get the robotics mod so you can use the hinges to adjust the angle after you drive it to the location.
